title: Could the NBN create a larger more filled server?
body: This has probably been posted before but I've just gotten FTTN proper and now feel more able to play LoL. If it worked as advertised could this open up the doors to people who have not been able to get into league due to internet issues or never tried due to lag? I know that Oceania is more than AU but it is where the server is based etc.

replies.body:
Australia will forever be using cup and string technology compared to the rest of the world when it comes to internet. I'll be long buried before I see FTTN here, stuck on dodgy adsl off-net for life it seems.
Why they never continued with the FTTH instead of this BS bandaid fix I will never know.

RIP online gaming in Australia
not even an estimated year for it to come to you? damn
It has been estimated "expect to see it rolling out within the year" every time I ask, and I have been asking for quite a few years now! I have given up asking
I got nbn about a week ago, get 7-8 ping and dont ever see any lag spikes

I had NBN since it was first announced, and I've been getting lag pretty often recently.
I know that Netflix really messes with the internet, but even when that's not on, it just really fks up a lot.
Still don't know why...
it's worth checking out, I had issues for 3 months and they only got fixed yesterday after 3 months of chatting to Telstra.
